alert.note: Alert for Bernalillo; Catron; Cibola; McKinley; Rio Arriba; Sandoval; Socorro; Valencia (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 26 at 11:46AM MST until February 26 at 12:15PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 PM MST FOR EASTERN CIBOLA...EAST CENTRAL MCKINLEY...NORTHWESTERN VALENCIA... SOUTHWESTERN RIO ARRIBA...SANDOVAL...NORTHWESTERN SOCORRO... BERNALILLO AND EAST CENTRAL CATRON COUNTIES... At 1145 AM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 7 miles northeast of Gallina to 10 miles southeast of Marquez to near the National Radio Astronomy Observatory, moving east at 45 mph. Isolated thunder is also possible. HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 107 and 160. Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 209 and 213, and between Mile Markers 223 and 245. Highway 550 between Mile Markers 1 and 81. Highway 60 between Mile Markers 73 and 89, and near Mile Marker 91. Locations impacted include... Albuquerque, Rio Rancho, Los Lunas, Bernalillo, Cuba, Datil, Laguna Pueblo, Corrales, Los Ranchos De Albuquerque and Jemez Springs. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow down and turn on headlights! The visibility will suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.

area.areaDesc: Bernalillo; Catron; Cibola; McKinley; Rio Arriba; Sandoval; Socorro; Valencia
